result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Greg B Nelson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eiligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 3 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to DNA surcharge and Blood draw fee.  PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Attend a Victim Impact Panel.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Greg B Nelson in court with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing. Court quashes warrant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Sonderhouse makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 3 days)
  -  4 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*D/L REVOCATION:  36 MONTHS
*IGNITION INTERLOCK DEVICE:  36 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
____Attend a Victim Impact Panel 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department)

FINE:  $5,883.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of $500.00 cash posted by Defendant and remainder is due as a condition of extended supervision) NOTE:  $6,000.00 cash bail posted by Sharon Nelson is
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               to be returned to her

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
